mostExpensive.name: Pikachu Illustrator
mostExpensive.details: Awarded to winners of a 1998 illustration contest, extremely rare, PSA 10 graded copy sold for $5.275 million.

mostExpensive.name: Charizard
mostExpensive.details: Iconic card from Base Set, PSA 10 graded copy sold for $420,000.

mostExpensive.name: Blastoise
mostExpensive.details: One of only two known copies, CGC 8.5 graded copy sold for $360,000.

mostExpensive.name: Kangaskhan-Holo #115
mostExpensive.details: Awarded at 1998 Family Event in Japan, PSA 10 graded copy sold for $68,321.

mostExpensive.name: Charizard
mostExpensive.details: Released in 1996, notable for lack of rarity symbol, PSA 10 graded copy sold for $324,000.

leastExpensive.name: Lapras
leastExpensive.details: Despite being a 1st Edition card, Lapras from Fossil set is relatively inexpensive.

leastExpensive.name: Ralts
leastExpensive.details: Common card from modern set, typical low value.

leastExpensive.name: Magnemite
leastExpensive.details: Common card from modern set, typical low value.

leastExpensive.name: Basic Energy
leastExpensive.details: Abundant basic energy cards have minimal collectible value.

leastExpensive.name: Potion
leastExpensive.details: Common Trainer card, low collectible value.
